Outside, heavy rain pours down. Grandma returns, carrying a live chicken. She prepares a traditional Korean boiled chicken, baeksuk, and offers Sang-woo a tender drumstick. "This isn't Kentucky Chicken." "I said chicken. Who told you to drown it in water?" "I don't want it. I'm not eating." The boiled chicken feels strange to him, and he sulks and goes to sleep. "Ugh, I'm hungry." Sang-woo didn't expect 'baeksuk' to be this delicious. But Grandma caught a cold from the rain the day before. Feeling the warmth of the food, Sang-woo starts to act more caring. "I made something. Might be breakfast... or lunch." Now, he begins to explore the world outside the house. He watches a wild chase with the neighbor kid and a mad cow. "Oppa, just run a little faster!" "You did great. You really did!" Sang-woo pulls a cart loaded with pumpkins. It's market day. They wait for the bus into town. "Is the bus really coming?" For Grandma, who has no watch, time always moves a little slower. Sang-woo and Grandma arrive at the market. Shy Sang-woo watches her sell goods from behind a wall. Even if she sells everything, it'll only make a few thousand won. "They fit perfectly!" Still, she uses that money to buy her grandson new shoes... And even treats him to a bowl of jjajangmyeon.
